text.section:
An insurer may deviate from the rates filed by a rating organization if:
the insurer has filed the deviation to be applied with the rating organization and Commissioner;
the deviation is uniform in its application to all risks in the State of the class of insurance to which the deviation is to apply; and
the deviation is approved by the Commissioner.
The Commissioner may approve or disapprove a deviation as if the deviation filing were a rate filing and specify the period of time during which an approval will be effective.
